member.name: T:SySal.Executables.EasyReconstruct.DisplayForm
member.summary: Displays 3D views of tracks.

remarks.para:
The buttons in the Display group perform the following actions:
ButtonAction
Default viewsets the viewing point to its default position.
Zoom +,-zooms in/out the view.
Rotation/Panningwhen Rotation is enabled, dragging the image with the right mouse button pressed rotates it; otherwise, it is panned (transverse translation).
Isometricwhen enabled, the view is not in perspective (objects do not shrink with distance), but isometric. Usually, in isometric view, zoom factors must increase in order to have a good image.
Backgroundselects the background color.

The buttons in the Selection group perform the following actions:
ButtonAction
Segmentsshows all segments. This is called "Segment display" mode.
Tracksshows all tracks (with some constraints, see below). This is called "Track display" mode.
Verticesshows all vertices (with some constraints, see below). This is called "Vertex display" mode.
Graph from Track #shows the graph starting from the specified track number. This is called "Graph display" mode.
Graph from Vertex #shows the graph starting from the specified vertex number. This is called "Graph display" mode.
Show segmentsturns on segment viewing when showing tracks/vertices/graphs.
Min segmentsminimum number of segments to show a track in "Track display" mode.
Min tracksminimum number of attached tracks to show a vertex in "Vertex display" mode.
Plotrefreshes the display.
Savesaves the plot in a standard 2D format or in the X3L format for 3D viewing and analysis.

The sliders in the Graphics area tune the following properties:
SliderProperty
Alphathe opaqueness of lines and points. 0 means transparent, 1 means opaque.
Linesthe thickness of lines.
Pointsthe size of points.
A double click with the left mouse button near a graphical element (line or point) opens the corresponding browser (TrackBrowser for tracks, VertexBrowser for vertices).

member.name: T:SySal.Executables.EasyReconstruct.MainForm
member.summary: EasyReconstruct - GUI tool to perform reconstructions by AlphaOmegaReconstruction.

remarks.para: EasyReconstruct can work on already reconstructed TSR files, or on data that come from files/DB.
To load a TSR file, press the Load button in the Reconstruction Input File group.

To load data from an ASCII list file that specifies the zones, do the following steps:
select the file and load the list by clicking on the Load List button
change/reset/set the selection according to your needs
click on Load Zones to actually load the set of zones.
If you want to save your selection, you can do by clicking on the Save List File button. The selection string is a mathematical expression that deselects a track when its value is zero, and selects the track otherwise. The available quantities are shown in the combobox adjacent to the selection text. Click on the Insert button to insert the variable selected in the combobox, or type it manually.

The list file should carry be formatted as follows:
On the first line, either FileSystem or Database must appear, to indicate which is the data source.
Zones must be listed in order of decreasing Z, in lines following the first.
Each line must contain the following fields (those in brackets are optional): zone_file_path|dbzone Z [sheet_id] [alignment_ignore_list_file_path]. If data come from files, zone_file_path is the full path to each TLG file. If the source is a DB, dbzone is a string like 8\35 (meaning brick 8, zoneid = 35). The alignment_ignore_list_file_path is an optional file that contains the list of Ids of tracks to be ignored in alignment. If the extension of the path is ".TLG", the list is extracted from the BaseTrackIgnoreAlignment section of the TLG; if the extension is not ".TLG", the file is assumed to be an ASCII file, with word Index on the first line, and zero-based Ids of tracks to be ignored during alignment computation on the following lines (one per each line).
The last line must not be empty. It can optionally contain a text beginning with Selection: and followed by a selection string to select/deselect tracks for volume reconstruction.
FileSystem c:\mydata\plate_1.tlg
Loading data can take a long time. In the meanwhile, you can load/edit/save configurations by the associated buttons.
Output results can be saved to a TSR file by clicking on the Save button of the Reconstruction Output File group.

The action buttons are described as follows:
ButtonAction
Processprocesses data from scratch, performing alignment, track connection and topological/vertexing analysis, as defined by the configuration. If you want to reprocess data that have been already processed, reload the zones or the original TSR file.
Vertexingperforms topological reconstruction only.
Stopinterrupts the current processing operation. This command might take some time to execute.
Show datashows alignment data for each pair of adjacent plates. The fits are obtained from as many segments as defined in the Fitting Segments box, if available. An Analysis Form is opened.
Clear reportclears the log panel.
Toggle Infoshows/hides the right panel with internal information about execution.
Efficiencystarts a computation module that computes the efficiency. This function should be considered obsolete.
Displayopens a DisplayGDI form to show tracks. Only the tracks that pass the selection defined by the box on the left (if not empty) are used for display. If the box is empty, all tracks are used.

member.name: T:SySal.Executables.EasyReconstruct.TrackBrowser
member.summary: TrackBrowser - shows information about a volume track.

remarks.para: The upper group shows the track parameters, which can be dumped to an ASCII file.
The lower group shows the segments, and they can be dumped to an ASCII file.
A comment can be set to a track. NOTICE: if NOVERTEX is set, the track is excluded from any possible vertex the next time topological reconstruction is started.
Two buttons allow one to navigate from a track to its upstream/downstream vertex (if any).
